title: Identify the Reaction Components
text: Start by identifying the components involved in the equilibrium reaction: CH₃COOH (aq)⇌H⁺ (aq)+CH₃COO⁻ (aq).

title: Write the Expression for K
text: The equilibrium constant expression K for the reaction is given by the formula: $$K=\frac{[H⁺][CH₃COO⁻]/[CH₃COOH][H⁺][CH₃COO⁻]/[CH₃COOH]}{[H⁺][CH₃COO⁻]/[CH₃COOH]}$$.

title: Substitute the Concentrations
text: Substitute the given concentrations into the equilibrium expression: $$[H⁺]=0.0032$$, $$[CH₃COO⁻]=0.0032$$, and $$[CH₃COOH]=0.210$$.

title: Calculate the Numerator
text: Calculate the product of the concentrations of the products: $$0.0032\times0.0032$$.

title: Calculate the Equilibrium Constant
text: Divide the result from the previous step by the concentration of the reactant: $$\frac{0.0032\times0.0032}{0.21}$$.
